ai-thig5.9:1.1_0: My hair mown off, covered in mud,
ai-thig5.9:1.2_0: I used to wander wearing just one robe.
ai-thig5.9:1.3_0: I saw fault where there was none,
ai-thig5.9:1.4_0: and blind to the actual fault,
ai-thig5.9:2.4_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-thig5.9:3.1_0: I bent my knee and bowed,
ai-thig5.9:3.2_0: and in his presence raised my joined palms.
ai-thig5.9:4.1_0: “I’ve wandered among the Aṅgans and Magadhans,
ai-thig5.9:4.3_0: I have eaten the alms-food of the nations
ai-thig5.9:4.4_0: Even the eaten of a debt,
ai-thig5.9:5.1_0: “O! He has made so much merit!
ai-thig5.9:5.2_0: That lay follower is so very wise.
ai-thig5.9:5.3_0: He gave a robe to Bhaddā,
ai-thig5.9:5.4_0: who is released from all ties.”
